intro: Afrardisia didymopora, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a notable species in botanical studies.
